TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit EventProvider extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: Use this class to write events.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To consume events written using the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEvent%2A> and <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteTransferEvent%2A> methods, the events must be defined in a manifest; events written using the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteMessageEvent%2A> method do not require a manifest.
Events can contain the following managed data types:
- bool
- Boolean
- byte
- char
- decimal
- double
- float
- Guid
- int
- IntPtr
- long
- sbyte
- short
- string
- uint
- UInt64
If an event in your manifest uses the `Boolean` in-type, you cannot write the data element using a `Boolean` data type in your managed code. The `Boolean` in-type in your manifest expects a 4-byte value, and a `Boolean` data type in managed code is 1-byte. Instead, you must use an `int` data type to write the value. If you want to log a `Boolean` value, use the UInt8 in-type in your manifest.

MemberSignature.Value: public EventProvider (Guid providerGuid);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype System.Guid providerGuid) cil managed

Docs.param: Guid that uniquely identifies the provider.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Registers the provider. To remove the registration when finished, call the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.Close%2A> method.

Docs.exception: There is not enough memory to complete the operation.
The classes in the namespace work only on Windows Vista.
An error returned by the ETW subsystem.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void Close ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Close() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes the provider's registration from the ETW subsystem and releases all unmanaged resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You should call this method when finished instead of waiting for the system to dispose of the resources.

Docs.exception: An error returned by the ETW subsystem.

.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.Guid CreateActivityId() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a unique activity identifier for the provider.
Docs.returns: A unique Guid that you use when calling the method to set the activity identifier for the provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is a static method.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEventErrorCode GetLastWriteEventError ();
.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider/WriteEventErrorCode GetLastWriteEventError() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the last error associated with an event write failure.
Docs.returns: Use the value to determine the cause of an event write failure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteEvent%2A>, <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteMessageEvent%2A>, and <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.WriteTransferEvent%2A> methods set this value if they fail to write the event.
This is a static method.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsEnabled ();
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsEnabled() cil managed

Docs.summary: Determines whether any session enabled the provider, regardless of the level and keyword values used to enable the provider.
Docs.returns: Is if the provider is enabled to any session; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically, a provider does not call this method to determine whether the provider has been enabled by a session; the provider simply writes the event, and ETW determines whether the event is logged to the session. A provider may want to call this function if the provider needs to perform extra work to generate the event. In this case, calling this function first may save resources and time.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsEnabled (byte level, long keywords);
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsEnabled(unsigned int8 level, int64 keywords) cil managed

Docs.param: Level of detail included in the event.
Bit mask that specifies the event category. This mask should be the same keyword mask that is defined in the manifest for the event.
Docs.summary: Determines whether any session is requesting the specified event from the provider.
Docs.returns: Is if any session is requesting the specified event; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically, a provider does not call this method to determine whether a session requested the specified event; the provider simply writes the event, and ETW determines whether the event is logged to a session. A provider may want to call this function if the provider needs to perform extra work to generate the event. In this case, calling this function first to determine if a session requested the event or not, may save resources and time.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetActivityId (ref Guid id);
.method public static hidebysig void SetActivityId(valuetype System.Guid id) cil managed

Docs.param: A unique activity identifier that the method returns.
Docs.summary: Sets the current activity identifier used by the methods.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The identifier is stored in the thread context.
Note that in version 3.5 of the .NET framework, you had to set the `id` parameter of this method and the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CorrelationManager.ActivityId%2A> property value to the same identifier value. However, in version 4.0 of the framework, the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.SetActivityId%2A> method automatically sets the correlation activity identifier for you.
This is a static method.

Docs.summary: Writes an event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use these methods if you use a manifest to define your events.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool WriteEvent (ref System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, object[] eventPayload);
.method public hidebysig instance bool WriteEvent(valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, object[] eventPayload) cil managed

Docs.param: An instance of that identifies the event to write.

An array of objects that contain the event data to write. The object must be in the order specified in the manifest. The array is limited to 32 objects, of which only eight may be strings. The maximum data size for the event is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.
This parameter can be null.
Docs.summary: Writes an event. The event data is specified as an array of objects.
Docs.returns: Is if the event is written; otherwise, . If false, call the method to determine the cause of the failure.
Docs.exception: The parameter contains too many objects or strings.

.method public hidebysig instance bool WriteEvent(valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, string data) cil managed

Docs.param: An instance of that identifies the event to write.
The string to write as the event data.
Docs.summary: Writes an event. The event data is specified as a string.
Docs.returns: Is if the event is written; otherwise, . If false, call the method to determine the cause of the failure.

MemberSignature.Value: protected bool WriteEvent (ref System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, int dataCount, IntPtr data);
.method familyhidebysig instance bool WriteEvent(valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, int32 dataCount, native int data) cil managed

Docs.param: An instance of that identifies the event to write.

Size of the event data to which the data parameter points. The maximum event data size is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.
Pointer to the event data to write.
Docs.summary: Writes an event. The event data is specified as a block of memory.
Docs.returns: Is if the event is written; otherwise, . If false, call the method to determine the cause of the failure.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you call the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.SetActivityId%2A> method to specify an activity identifier for the event, this method retrieves the identifier from the thread context and includes it with the event.

Docs.summary: Writes an event that contains a string as its data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks These methods do not require a manifest to consume the event.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool WriteMessageEvent (string eventMessage);
.method public hidebysig instance bool WriteMessageEvent(string eventMessage) cil managed

Docs.param: String to write as the event data.
Docs.summary: Writes an event that contains a string as its data.
Docs.returns: Is if the event is written; otherwise, . If false, call the method to determine the cause of the failure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The maximum string length is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.
## Examples
``` if (!provider.WriteMessageEvent("Event string.")) Console.WriteLine(EventProvider.GetLastWriteEventError()); ```

MemberSignature.Value: public bool WriteMessageEvent (string eventMessage, byte eventLevel, long eventKeywords);
.method public hidebysig instance bool WriteMessageEvent(string eventMessage, unsigned int8 eventLevel, int64 eventKeywords) cil managed

Docs.param: String to write as the event data.
Level of detail included in the event. If the provider uses a manifest to define the event, set this value to the same level defined in the manifest.
Bit mask that specifies the event category. If the provider uses a manifest to define the event, set this value to the same keyword mask defined in the manifest.
Docs.summary: Writes an event that contains a string as its data if the level and keyword value match the events requested by the session.
Docs.returns: Is if the event is written; otherwise, . If false, call the method to determine the cause of the failure.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool WriteTransferEvent (ref System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, Guid relatedActivityId, object[] eventPayload);

.method public hidebysig instance bool WriteTransferEvent(valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, valuetype System.Guid relatedActivityId, object[] eventPayload) cil managed

Docs.param: An instance of that identifies the event to write.
Activity identifier from the previous component. Use this parameter to link your component's events to the previous component's events.

An array of objects that contain the event data to write. The data must be in the order specified in the manifest. The array is limited to 32 objects, of which only eight may be strings. The maximum data size for the event is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.
Docs.summary: Links events together when tracing events in an end-to-end scenario. The event data is specified as an array of objects.
Docs.returns: Is if the event is written; otherwise, . If false, call the method to determine the cause of the failure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The method uses the activity ID set in the thread context to identify this component. To set the activity ID, call the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.SetActivityId%2A> method.
If you use the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Trace> class, you do not use the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.SetActivityId%2A> method to specify the activity ID. Instead, access the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Trace.CorrelationManager%2A> property to get the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CorrelationManager> object. Then, set the <xref:System.Diagnostics.CorrelationManager.ActivityId%2A> property to the activity ID. You must also set the `relatedActivityId` to a <xref:System.Diagnostics.CorrelationManager.ActivityId%2A> value.

Docs.exception: If contains too many objects or strings.

MemberSignature.Value: protected bool WriteTransferEvent (ref System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, Guid relatedActivityId, int dataCount, IntPtr data);

.method familyhidebysig instance bool WriteTransferEvent(valuetype System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventDescriptor eventDescriptor, valuetype System.Guid relatedActivityId, int32 dataCount, native int data) cil managed

Docs.param: An instance of that identifies the event to write.
Activity identifier from the previous component. Use this parameter to link your component's events to the previous component's events.

Size of the event data to which the data parameter points. The maximum event data size is limited to 64 KB minus the size of the event headers. The event size is less if the session's buffer size is less and the session includes extended data items with the event.
Pointer to the event data to write.
Docs.summary: Links events together when tracing events in an end-to-end scenario. The event data is specified as a block of memory.
Docs.returns: Is if the event is written; otherwise, . If false, call the method to determine the cause of the failure.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The method uses the activity ID set in the thread context to identify this component. To set the activity ID, call the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Eventing.EventProvider.SetActivityId%2A> method.
